metadata.name: Webshell ReGeorg Detection Via Web Logs
metadata.comment: Certain strings in the uri_query field when combined with null referer and null user agent can indicate activity associated with the webshell ReGeorg.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM http_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND ((contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('cmd=read')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('connect&target')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('cmd=connect')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('cmd=disconnect')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('cmd=forward'))) AND http_request.referrer is null AND http_request.user_agent is null AND lower(http_request.http_method) = lower('post'))

output.summary: Certain strings in the uri_query field when combined with null referer and null user agent can indicate activity associated with the webshell ReGeorg.

metadata.objective: Examine fields: http_request.args, http_request.referrer, http_request.http_method, cs-User-Agent False positive: Web applications that use the same URL parameters as ReGeorg References: https://community.rsa.com/community/products/netwitness/blog/2019/02/19/web-shells-and-netwitness-part-3, https://github.com/sensepost/reGeorg
